eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.jdbc

Class JdbcConnectionPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.jdbc.JdbcConnectionPool

  • public class JdbcConnectionPool
extends Object
    Instantiates a connection pool to a database using JDBC.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JdbcConnectionPool

        public JdbcConnectionPool(String driver,
                          String url,
                          Properties props,
                          Logger log)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        driver - JDBC driver to be used for the connection.
        url - A string specifying the database connection URL.
        props - Properties to be used for the connection, including username and password.
        log - Handle to the log file for keeping messages and statistics.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataSource

        public org.apache.commons.dbcp2.PoolingDataSource<org.apache.commons.dbcp2.PoolableConnection> getDataSource()
        Provides a JDBC DataSource making a pool of connections available.
        Returns:
        A JDBC data source.

      • getConnectionPool

        public org.apache.commons.pool2.impl.GenericObjectPool<org.apache.commons.dbcp2.PoolableConnection> getConnectionPool()
        Provides a pool of connections available for a JDBC data source.
        Returns:
        A pool of connections.

      • checkPoolStatus

        public String checkPoolStatus()
        Notify about the status of this connection pool.
        Returns:
        A string with statistics about connectivity to the JDBC source.

      • initDbConnector

        public JdbcConnector initDbConnector()
        Provides a new JDBC connection for querying the underlying DBMS.
        Returns:
        A JDBC connection that can be used for querying a specific attribute.

      • getDbSystem

        public String getDbSystem()
        Provides the name of the DBMS that this connection pool has access to.
        Returns:
        The name of the DBMS (e.g., POSTGRESQL) as mentioned in the respective JDBC driver.

      • setDbSystem

        public void setDbSystem(String dbSystem)
        Specifies the name of the DBMS that this connection pool has access to.
        Parameters:
        dbSystem - The name of the DBMS (e.g., POSTGRESQL) as mentioned in the respective JDBC driver.
